publicationStmt.publisher: The Characters that shaped the Silk Road - A Database and Digital Paleography of Tarim

history.provenance: found in Qizil Miŋ-Öyduring T III MQ 143.1

list.item: a1 illegible a2 /// (ka)ntiś yikṣye masa [o](k) t(o)_m(\) /// a3 pañcwari[k]e jñānacaṃ[nd]re lyāka jñanaca saṅ_k_astere ślacaṃndre śa(rsa) – a4 i_k_aṃ ñune śle trukāle k[a]ntiś yikṣye ok to_m\ piś ṣaṅ_k_aṃ klese [tau] a5 pañcwari[k]e jñānacaṃndre lyāka jñanaca saṅ_k_astere ślacaṃndre śarsa – a6 ñweṃne trukāle sumaiśe wasa kantine yikṣye ok to_m\ piś ṣaṅ_k_aṃ a7 klese tau piś ṣaṅ_k_aṃ a8 pañcwari[k]e jñānacaṃndre lyāka jñanaca saṅ_k_astere ślacaṃndre /// a9 meñe o(kta)nte a10 meñe me[ṅk]ine massa a11 wi meñantse ne trukāle vinaiyśe wasa kantine yikṣye cāk wi tom\ ÷ a12 klese wi to_m\ a13 pañcwari[k]e «†–» sarwañatewe lyāka sa saṅ_k_astere ślacaṃndre śarsa ślacandre a14 traiy meñantse ne trukāle [tu]ṣi wasa kantine ynaikentāñe naiṣṣi śwāle wasa a15 śwer meñantse ne trukāle aśari sarwarakṣite wasa ÷ a16 kantine śwālene śro kant(i)_ś\ yikṣye śwāra cakanma ṣkas to_m\ ÷ a17 pa – – (–) nte_ś\ śwāra cakanma ÷ opi_ś\ cāk piś to_m\ a18 k[a]kwārne tarya to_m\ ÷ a19 pañcwari[k]e prajñākaracaṃndre lyāka pajñā saṅ_k_astere āryawarme śarsa [¤] a20 (pi)[ś m]eñantse ne trukāle caṃndre ṣamāne wasa kantine – – pesa[n]e[nts]e śano wa[r··] a21 ṣkas meñantse ne sāṅki_ś trukālene yikṣye tarya to_m\ kantine śwālene a22 yikṣye masa cā_k\ wi to_m\ ÷ a23 pañcwari[k]e āryatewe lyāka ā saṅ_k_astere āryawarme [śa](rsa) – a24 (ṣ)[u]k meña[nt]se ne sāṅki_ś\ śle trukāle kantiś yikṣye ṣuk to_m\ /// a25 pañcwari[k]e āryatewe lyāka ā saṅ_k_astere āryawarme śar(sa) – a26 ok meñantse ne sāṅki_ś\ śle trukālene kantiś yikṣye piś to(_m\) – – a27 pañcwari[k]e āryatewe lyāka ā saṅ_k_astere āryawarme śarsa /// a28 ñu meñantse ne sāṅki_ś\ śle trukāle kantiś yikṣye masa «†(pi)–» «śwāra» /// a29 ś ṣaṅ_k_aṃ a30 pañcwari[k]e āryatewe lyāka ā saṅ_k_astere āryawa /// a31 śak ṣene sāṅki_ś\ śle trukāle kantiś yikṣye [t]au ·i /// a32 (pañcwarik)e sarwañatewe lyāka saṅ(_k_ast)e(re) /// b1 ¤ b2 ¤

Alternative classifications:
Peyrotcolloquial
Malzahn–
Tamai–
Tamai-C14–

  • "Verso side blank." removed from remarks, since there are signatures on the verso. References sorted by line number, they've been a mess. There are different readings in Ching 2010, e.g. a16 śro kantaś (no sign of an i), a30 ārya... etc. –Martin (Mon, 2015-05-04, 15:51:12)

Translation from [[Ching 2010]]: 274–277:
a1 ...
a2 /// [for kanti, yikṣye] was spent: [eight pecks]. ///
a3 Jñānacaṃndre the Pañcwarike has seen. ¤ Ślacaṃndre the Saṅkästere [has recognized].
a4 On the 29th day, for the kanti together with allocation, yikṣye: eight pecks, five pints. klese: one peck, ...
a5 Jñānacaṃndre the Pañcwarike has seen. ¤ Ślacaṃndre the Saṅkästere [has recognized].
a6-a7 On the last (=30th) day, Sumaiśe gave (his offerings as) allocation. The yikṣye in kanti: eight pecks, five [pints]. klese: one peck, five pints.
a8 Jñānacaṃndre the Pañcwarike has seen. ¤ Ślacaṃndre the Saṅkästere ///
a9 The [8th] month.
a10 [The month] went out in a lack (?).
a11-a12 On the 2nd day of the month, Vinaiyśe gave (his offerings as) allocation. yikṣye in kanti: one picul, two pecks. [klese]: two pecks.
a13 Sarwañatewe the Pañcwarike has seen. ¤ Ślacaṃndre the Saṅkästere has recognized. ¤
a14 On the 3rd day of the month, Tuṣi gave (his offerings as) allocation, in (the form of) kanti. The Great Commissioner (?) of Ynaikentā gave (his offerings as) food.
a15 On the 4th day of the month, the Master Sarwarakṣite gave (his offerings as) allocation.
a16 For śrokanta*, yikṣye (used) in kanti as food: four piculs, six pecks.
a17 For ...: [four] piculs. For opiye*, one picul, five pecks.
a18 In [kakwār*](?): three pecks.
a19 Prajñākaracaṃndre the Pañcwarike has seen. ¤ Āryawarme the Saṅkästere has recognized. ¤
a20 On the [5th] day of the month, the monk Caṃndre gave (his offerings as) allocation, in (the form of kanti. ... a woman ... to/of ...
a21-a22 On the 6th day of the month, in the allocation for the saṃgha, yikṣye: three pecks, in kanti. In meal, ... yikṣye was spent: one picul, two pecks.
a23 Āryatewe the Pañcwarike has seen. ¤ Āryawarme the Saṅkästere [has recognized].
a24 On the [7th day of the month], for the saṃgha and for the kanti (as) allocation, yikṣye: seven pecks ///
a25 Āryatewe the Pañcwarike has seen. ¤ Āryawarme the Saṅkästere [has recognized].
a26 On the 8th day of the month, for the saṃgha and for the kanti in allocation, yikṣye: five [pecks]
a27 Āryatewe the Pañcwarike has seen. ¤ Āryawarme the Saṅkästere has recognized. ///
a28-a29 On the 9th day of the month, for the saṃgha and for the kanti (as) allocation, yikṣye was spent: four pints.
a30 Āryatewe the Pañcwarike has seen. ¤ [Āryawarme] the Saṅkästere ///
a31 On the 11th day, for the saṃgha and for the kanti (as) allocation, yikṣye: [one peck, five pints]. ///
a32 Sarwañatewe the (Pañcwarike) has seen. [Saṅkästere] ///
b1 ¤
b2 ¤

a2 /// (ka)ntiś yäkṣiye|yikṣye masa okt|o(k) t(o)m /// a3 pañcwarike jñānacaṃndre lyāka ¤|jñanaca saṅkästere ślacaṃndre śa(rsa) – a4 ikäṃ ñune śle trukāle kantiś yäkṣiye|yikṣye okt|ok tom piś ṣaṅkäṃ klese tau a5 pañcwarike jñānacaṃndre lyāka ¤|jñanaca saṅkästere ślacaṃndre śarsa – a6 ñweṃne trukāle sumaiśe wasa kantine yäkṣiye|yikṣye okt|ok tom piś ṣaṅkäṃ a7 klese tau piś ṣaṅkäṃ a8 pañcwarike jñānacaṃndre lyāka ¤|jñanaca saṅkästere ślacaṃndre /// a9 meñe o(kta)nte a10 meñe meṅkine massa a11 wi meñantse -ne trukāle vinaiyśe wasa kantine yäkṣiye|yikṣye cāk wi tom ÷ a12 klese wi tom a13 pañcwarike sarwañatewe lyāka ¤|sa saṅkästere ślacaṃndre śarsa ¤|ślacandre a14 trai|traiy meñantse -ne trukāle tuṣi wasa kantine ynaikentāññe|ynaikentāñe naiṣṣi śwālle|śwāle wasa a15 śtwer|śwer meñantse -ne trukāle aśari sarwarakṣite wasa ÷ a16 kantine śwāllene|śwālene śro kant(i)ś yäkṣiye|yikṣye śtwāra|śwāra cakanma ṣkas tom ÷ a17 pa – – – nteś śtwāra|śwāra cakanma ÷ opiś cāk piś tom a18 kakwārne tarya tom ÷ a19 pañcwarike prajñākaracaṃndre lyāka ¤|pajñā saṅkästere āryawarme śarsa ¤ a20 (pi)ś meñantse -ne trukāle caṃndre ṣamāne wasa kantine – – pesanentse śano war·· a21 ṣkas meñantse -ne sāṅkiś trukālene yäkṣiye|yikṣye tarya tom kantine śwāllene|śwālene a22 yäkṣiye|yikṣye masa cāk wi tom ÷ a23 pañcwarike āryatewe lyāka ¤|ā saṅkästere āryawarme śa(rsa) – a24 ṣukt|(ṣ)uk meñantse -ne sāṅkiś śle trukāle kantiś yäkṣiye|yikṣye ṣukt|ṣuk tom /// a25 pañcwarike āryatewe lyāka ¤|ā saṅkästere āryawarme śar(sa) – a26 okt|ok meñantse -ne sāṅkiś śle trukālene kantiś yäkṣiye|yikṣye piś to(m) – – a27 pañcwarike āryatewe lyāka ¤|ā saṅkästere āryawarme śarsa /// a28 ñu meñantse -ne sāṅkiś śle trukāle kantiś yäkṣiye|yikṣye masa śtwāra|śwāra /// a29 -ś ṣaṅkäṃ a30 pañcwarike āryatewe lyāka ¤|ā saṅkästere āryawa(rme) /// a31 śak ṣene sāṅkiś śle trukāle kantiś yäkṣiye|yikṣye tau ·i /// a32 (pañcwarik)e sarwañatewe lyāka saṅ(käst)e(re) /// b1 ¤ b2 ¤

div.p:
Alternative classifications:

  • "Verso side blank." removed from remarks, since there are signatures on the verso. References sorted by line number, they've been a mess. There are different readings in Ching 2010, e.g. śro kantaś (no sign of an i), ārya... etc. –Martin (Mon, 2015-05-04, 15:51:12)

Translation from <citedRange>274</citedRange></bibl>–277: a1 ... a2 /// [for <hi>kanti</hi>, <hi>yikṣye</hi>] was spent: [eight pecks]. /// a3 <hi>Jñānacaṃndre</hi> the <hi>Pañcwarike</hi> has seen. ¤ <hi>Ślacaṃndre</hi> the <hi>Saṅkästere</hi> [has recognized]. a4 On the 29th day, for the <hi>kanti</hi> together with allocation, <hi>yikṣye</hi>: eight pecks, five pints. <hi>klese</hi>: one peck, ... a5 <hi>Jñānacaṃndre</hi> the <hi>Pañcwarike</hi> has seen. ¤ <hi>Ślacaṃndre</hi> the <hi>Saṅkästere</hi> [has recognized]. a6-a7 On the last (=30th) day, <hi>Sumaiśe</hi> gave (his offerings as) allocation. The <hi>yikṣye</hi> in <hi>kanti</hi>: eight pecks, five [pints]. <hi>klese</hi>: one peck, five pints. a8 <hi>Jñānacaṃndre</hi> the <hi>Pañcwarike</hi> has seen. ¤ <hi>Ślacaṃndre</hi> the <hi>Saṅkästere</hi> /// a9 The [8th] month. a10 [The month] went out in a lack (?). a11-a12 On the 2nd day of the month, <hi>Vinaiyśe</hi> gave (his offerings as) allocation. <hi>yikṣye</hi> in <hi>kanti</hi>: one picul, two pecks. [<hi>klese</hi>]: two pecks. a13 <hi>Sarwañatewe</hi> the <hi>Pañcwarike</hi> has seen. ¤ <hi>Ślacaṃndre</hi> the <hi>Saṅkästere</hi> has recognized. ¤ a14 On the 3rd day of the month, <hi>Tuṣi</hi> gave (his offerings as) allocation, in (the form of) <hi>kanti</hi>. The Great Commissioner (?) of <hi>Ynaikentā</hi> gave (his offerings as) food. a15 On the 4th day of the month, the Master <hi>Sarwarakṣite</hi> gave (his offerings as) allocation. a16 For <hi>śrokanta</hi>*, <hi>yikṣye</hi> (used) in <hi>kanti</hi> as food: four piculs, six pecks. a17 For ...: [four] piculs. For <hi>opiye</hi>*, one picul, five pecks. a18 In [<hi>kakwār</hi>*](?): three pecks. a19 <hi>Prajñākaracaṃndre</hi> the <hi>Pañcwarike</hi> has seen. ¤ <hi>Āryawarme</hi> the <hi>Saṅkästere</hi> has recognized. ¤ a20 On the [5th] day of the month, the monk <hi>Caṃndre</hi> gave (his offerings as) allocation, in (the form of <hi>kanti</hi>. ... a woman ... to/of ... a21-a22 On the 6th day of the month, in the allocation for the <hi>saṃgha</hi>, <hi>yikṣye</hi>: three pecks, in <hi>kanti</hi>. In meal, ... <hi>yikṣye</hi> was spent: one picul, two pecks. a23 <hi>Āryatewe</hi> the <hi>Pañcwarike</hi> has seen. ¤ <hi>Āryawarme</hi> the <hi>Saṅkästere</hi> [has recognized]. a24 On the [7th day of the month], for the <hi>saṃgha</hi> and for the <hi>kanti</hi> (as) allocation, <hi>yikṣye</hi>: seven pecks /// a25 <hi>Āryatewe</hi> the <hi>Pañcwarike</hi> has seen. ¤ <hi>Āryawarme</hi> the <hi>Saṅkästere</hi> [has recognized]. a26 On the 8th day of the month, for the <hi>saṃgha</hi> and for the <hi>kanti</hi> in allocation, <hi>yikṣye</hi>: five [pecks] a27 <hi>Āryatewe</hi> the <hi>Pañcwarike</hi> has seen. ¤ <hi>Āryawarme</hi> the <hi>Saṅkästere</hi> has recognized. /// a28-a29 On the 9th day of the month, for the <hi>saṃgha</hi> and for the <hi>kanti</hi> (as) allocation, <hi>yikṣye</hi> was spent: four pints. a30 <hi>Āryatewe</hi> the <hi>Pañcwarike</hi> has seen. ¤ [<hi>Āryawarme</hi>] the <hi>Saṅkästere</hi> /// a31 On the 11th day, for the <hi>saṃgha</hi> and for the <hi>kanti</hi> (as) allocation, <hi>yikṣye</hi>: [one peck, five pints]. /// a32 <hi>Sarwañatewe</hi> the (<hi>Pañcwarike</hi>) has seen. [<hi>Saṅkästere</hi>] /// b1 ¤ b2 ¤</p></project_comment>
